title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, January 21, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss writes to his wife, describing camp life and activities. Yankee troops had been making some demonstrations, but no battles had developed. He writes of food supplies, and responds to news of the family. He also describes the sacked city of Fredericksburg.
keywords: Troop Movement, Military Authority, Death/Casualites, Family, Camp Life, Women, Home Front, Prisons/Prisoners, African Americans, Slavery, American Civil War
